src:
À Attin, les cellules commerciales disparaissent du paysage
02 Nov 2019, 10:06 by Le Journal du Montreuil

Attin


Entre Gamm vert et le restaurant Buona Pasta, l’enseigne Leclerc va développer un nouveau concept

Les anciennes cellules commerciales qui hébergeaient par le passé un fleuriste, une boucherie et une boulangerie viennent de disparaître. Une étape incontournable au regard de l’état général des bâtiments mais aussi pour laisser le champ libre à un nouveau projet commercial. Ce dernier est porté par la direction du magasin Leclerc, à quelques mètres de là. D’ici plusieurs mois, la parcelle de près de 2400m² accueillera un local flambant neuf et un concept commercial unique dans l’arrondissement. Il s’agira d’un magasin Leclerc occasion. Le principe est simple, ce commerce peut vous reprendre les objets dont vous n’avez plus besoin (téléphone, télévision, console de jeux, électroménager…). En retour, vous bénéficierez de bons d’achat valables dans le supermarché Leclerc.
Un concept qui a fait ses preuves dans d’autres régions françaises.
text:
UN Secretary General urges Thailand to solve environmental problems - reduce marine waste

02 Nov 2019, 10:12


The Prime Minister confirms Thailand and ASEAN join the UN to move forward with sustainable development. UN Secretary-General asks Thailand to help drive environmental solutions - reduce waste at sea

On 2 Nov at the Impact Forum Building, Gen. Prayut Chan-ocha, Prime Minister and Defense Minister Met bilateral discussions with UN Secretary-General Antonio Ukuse During the 35th ASEAN Summit and related summits, Mrs. Narumon Piniyosinwat Spokesman of the Prime Minister's Office Said after the meeting that the Prime Minister reaffirmed that Thailand places importance on creating a sustainable development partnership between ASEAN member countries and other regions. While ASEAN is ready to cooperate with the United Nations (UN) to promote the exchange of experiences with various groups Regarding the way of knowledge and experience So that countries can join together to achieve sustainable development goals In addition, Thailand is willing to increase the role. And more involved in the United Nations framework for organizing various activities In the Asia-Pacific region  



The UN Secretary-General spoke of praise to Thailand and the prime minister, who is active in the international arena. Including showing the vision in various challenges And also praised the outstanding Thai role in achieving sustainable development And confirms that the UN attaches importance to environmental issues By asking Thailand to be an important part in driving the solution of environmental problems Reducing greenhouse gas emissions, use of renewable energy And also appreciated the start of Thailand in the meeting on the reduction of waste in the sea A spokesman for the Prime Minister's Office said that in addition, the Prime Minister reiterated Thai policies in line with the UN cooperation approach, such as tackling illegal and unregulated fishing. Anti-human trafficking Prevention of sexual exploitation And human rights While the Secretary General of the United Nations wishes the Prime Minister and Thailand the success of this ASEAN summit.
